message.content: One of the most significant events that happened in North Korea in the past 100 years is the division of the Korean peninsula and the establishment of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) in 1948. This event marked the political separation of North Korea from South Korea, which eventually led to the Korean War (1950-1953) when North Korea, supported by China and the Soviet Union, attempted to reunify the peninsula by force. The division has had a lasting and profound impact on the history, politics, and international relations of the Korean Peninsula.
